qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Knoxville General Hospital and Richmond General Hospital, what were the chief complaints of patients L. Rogers and M. Young?

content: Blurry, foggy vision and decreased visual acuity for the past 3 months
Difficulty breathing and cyanosis occurring immediately after resuscitation

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Knoxville General Hospital, the chief complaint of patient L. Rogers was blurry, foggy vision and decreased visual acuity for the past 3 months. According to the hospitalization records of Richmond General Hospital, the chief complaint of patient M. Young was difficulty breathing and cyanosis occurring immediately after resuscitation.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Knoxville General Hospital and Richmond General Hospital, what were the preliminary diagnoses for patients L. Rogers and M. Young?

content: Bilateral Cataract, more pronounced in the right eye
Neonatal Pneumonia due to Amniotic Fluid Aspiration

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Knoxville General Hospital, the preliminary diagnosis for patient L. Rogers was bilateral cataract, more pronounced in the right eye. According to the hospitalization records of Richmond General Hospital, the preliminary diagnosis for patient M. Young was neonatal pneumonia due to amniotic fluid aspiration.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Knoxville General Hospital and Richmond General Hospital, who was admitted earlier, L. Rogers or M. Young?
qa_multi_document_compare.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Knoxville General Hospital, L. Rogers was admitted on January 6th; according to the hospitalization records of Richmond General Hospital, M. Young was admitted on February 28th. Therefore, L. Rogers was admitted earlier.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Knoxville General Hospital and Richmond General Hospital, whose pulse rate is higher, L. Rogers or M. Young?
qa_multi_document_compare.answer: According to the hospitalization records, L. Rogers' pulse rate at Knoxville General Hospital is 72 beats per minute, while M. Young's pulse rate at Richmond General Hospital is 150 beats per minute. Therefore, M. Young's pulse rate is higher.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Knoxville General Hospital and Richmond General Hospital, whose blood pressure is higher, L. Rogers or M. Young?
qa_multi_document_compare.answer: According to the hospitalization records, L. Rogers' blood pressure at Knoxville General Hospital is 120/80 mmHg, while M. Young's blood pressure at Richmond General Hospital is 65/40 mmHg. Therefore, L. Rogers' blood pressure is higher.
